body:
You mean, these warnings?

```
./rails/activesupport/lib/active_support/core_ext/hash/slice.rb:15: warning: method redefined; discarding old slice
./rails/.bundle/gems/gems/i18n-0.6.0/lib/i18n/core_ext/hash.rb:2: warning: previous definition of slice was here
./rails/activesupport/lib/active_support/core_ext/hash/deep_merge.rb:14: warning: method redefined; discarding old deep_merge!
./rails/.bundle/gems/gems/i18n-0.6.0/lib/i18n/core_ext/hash.rb:25: warning: previous definition of deep_merge! was here
./rails/activesupport/lib/active_support/core_ext/hash/except.rb:7: warning: method redefined; discarding old except
./rails/.bundle/gems/gems/i18n-0.6.0/lib/i18n/core_ext/hash.rb:8: warning: previous definition of except was here
./rails/.bundle/gems/gems/mail-2.4.4/lib/mail/core_extensions/nil.rb:6: warning: method redefined; discarding old blank?
./rails/activesupport/lib/active_support/core_ext/object/blank.rb:47: warning: previous definition of blank? was here
./rails/.bundle/gems/gems/mail-2.4.4/lib/mail/core_extensions/object.rb:6: warning: method redefined; discarding old blank?
./rails/activesupport/lib/active_support/core_ext/object/blank.rb:14: warning: previous definition of blank? was here
./rails/.bundle/gems/gems/mail-2.4.4/lib/mail/core_extensions/shell_escape.rb:33: warning: character class has duplicated range: /([^A-Za-z0-9_\s\+\-.,:\/@\n])/
./rails/.bundle/gems/gems/mail-2.4.4/lib/mail/patterns.rb:11: warning: assigned but unused variable - lwsp
```

The question that remains is: who is responsible? Rails? Mail? I18n? =(
Probably adding such `undef` calls solves them, just unsure if that's the best solution we have (and what are the others).

Thanks!
